This refers to the people assigned to each gate, responsible to control access to the city or temple, as well as to open and close the gates at times and for reasons set by the administrator. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:07:01|7:1]].
"temple singers"

tn.ref: all who have knowledge and understanding
tn.text: This phrase can be made explicit. AT: "all who were old enough to understand what promising to obey God meant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"their fellow brothers the nobles" or "their brothers the leaders." These phrases refer to the same people.

tn.ref: bound themselves with both a curse and an oath
tn.text: This speaks of the people taking an oath and a curse as if the oath and the curse were a rope that physically bound them.  AT: "swore themselves to an oath and a curse" or "they took an oath and called for a curse to come on themselves if they failed to keep it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is an idiom. AT: "to live by God's law" or "to obey God's law"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: which was given by Moses the servant of God
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which Moses the servant of God had given to Israel"
"to follow"
In these verses, the people describe the content of the oath they were making in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:10:28|10:29]].

tn.ref: would not give our daughters to the people of the land or take their daughters for our sons
tn.text: This means that they would not allow their sons and daughters to marry them. AT: "would not give our daughters to marry the people of the land or take their daughters to marry our sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the people who live in their land who do not worship Yahweh. AT: "the people of this land who do not worship Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: We promised ... we would not give ... we would not buy ... we will let ... we will cancel
tn.text: The pronoun "we" here includes Nehemiah and the Jewish people, but not the reader of this book. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclusive]])
"7th year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: we will let our fields rest
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "we will not plow our fields" or "we will not grow anything in our fields" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: we will cancel all debts contracted by other Jews
tn.text: "we will cancel all debts to other Jews" or "we will forgive all debts owned to us by other Jews"
In these verses, the people continue describing the content of the oath they were making in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:10:28 |10:29]].
"We promised to obey the command"
The pronoun "we" here includes all the Israelites including Nehemiah except for the priest and Levites, and does not include the reader of this book (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclusive]])

"1/3 of a shekel." "A third" means one part out of three equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "5 grams of sliver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
"to pay for the care of"
This refers to the 12 loaves of bread baked without yeast kept in the temple and used to symbolize God's presence with His people.
